items.title: ‘Mexsicko City’ Turns a Corner in Its Clean Air Marathon
items.abstract: Even amid other environmental gains, it is the improvement in air quality that has most burnished the city’s green credentials.

items.title: Monument to a City
items.abstract: Where I saw Paris in D.C., my French in-laws saw neo-Classical run wild.

items.title: A Saint in His City: Archie Manning in New Orleans
items.abstract: The Mannings, the first family of New Orleans quarterbacks, have called the city home since Archie, father of Peyton and Eli, was drafted by the Saints in 1971.

items.title: Two Cities in One
items.abstract: Do you live in Washington or in D.C.?

items.title: Cuomo to Cities: Just Borrow
items.abstract: Taking on new debt won’t solve the deep fiscal problems plaguing New York cities and towns. It will just make things worse.

items.title: Buffalo in the City
items.abstract: Once an icon of masculinity, the plaid pattern has become an accidental camp classic.

items.title: ‘Dream Cities,’ by Wade Graham
items.abstract: The ideas and structures that created today’s cities, and the architects and planners who implemented them.
keywords: Dream Cities: Seven Urban Ideas That Shape the World (Book)

items.title: Long Island City: Fast-Growing, With Great Views
items.abstract: Just a few years ago the Queens neighborhood was mostly filled with industrial buildings; today it’s a pleasant place to live, with large luxury towers rising in the neighborhood.

items.title: Eager to Move to the City, but Stranded in the Suburbs
items.abstract: Empty nesters drawn to the culture and convenience of Manhattan and Brooklyn, but facing soaring real estate prices, are rethinking their plans.

items.title: Tripoli, a Tense and Listless City With Gunmen and a Well-Stocked Hugo Boss Outlet
items.abstract: As conflict rages elsewhere in Libya, a precarious order holds in the capital, as heavily armed militias and politicians, nominally allied, vie for control.
keywords: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

items.title: Mexico City as the Director of ‘Roma’ Remembers It (and Hears It)
items.abstract: Alfonso Cuarón revisits the sights and sounds of the neighborhood that inspired his critically acclaimed film.

items.title: They Married at City Hall (But Didn’t Toss the Bouquet)
items.abstract: Three couples share their stories after marrying on a December day at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau, where the brides also rented their flowers.

items.title: Relief for New York City’s Transit Deserts? Commuter Trains Might Help
items.abstract: A planned billion-dollar rail expansion in the Bronx is fueling a larger debate over using aboveground trains to supplement subway and bus service.

items.title: What if Cities Are No Longer the Land of Opportunity for Low-Skilled Workers?
items.abstract: Dense cities have long promised higher wages, but now that is primarily true for workers with more education, a new analysis finds.

items.title: New York City Public Schools Should Be Evaluated Based on Diversity, Not Just Tests, Panel Says
items.abstract: A new report suggests the city enact sweeping measures to address entrenched segregation in education.

items.title: How Remote Work Is Devastating New York City’s Commuter Rails
items.abstract: Before the pandemic, they relied on office workers, who spent up to $500 a month on tickets. At the M.T.A., those sales are down 75 percent.

items.title: A Grim January Leaves Some New Yorkers Fearful for the City’s Future
items.abstract: New York is far safer and stronger than in the ’70s. But after a flood of sad news, many people are struggling to find grounds for optimism.

items.title: After Urban Flight, Corporate Campuses Add a Taste of the City
items.abstract: Suburban headquarters are being redesigned to add more amenities that will integrate better with their communities and attract the skilled workers.

items.title: ‘The Lost City’ and a Richard Linklater Film Will Play SXSW
items.abstract: The film festival will return to primarily in-person screenings in Austin, Texas, with some online options.
keywords: South by Southwest Music and Media Conference
The Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent (Movie)

items.title: Far From the Big City, New Economic Life
items.abstract: Incomes are low in small-town Tennessee, but so is the cost of living. That attraction could be a key to reviving many rural areas.
